intro: Deinbollia acuminata, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Menispermaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its climbing habit and distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
